column1: Noor is making coffee at a busy shop. Noor wants to make a yummy coffee with oat milk for a person. Noor picks a milk jar and puts oat milk in it. Noor thinks the milk jar has oat milk. A work friend, who didn't hear what the person wanted, changes the oat milk in the jar with almond milk while Noor is doing something else. Noor doesn't see her friend change the milk.
column2: Does Noor think the milk jar has oat milk or almond milk?
column3: Noor thinks the milk jar has oat milk.
column4: Noor thinks the milk jar has almond milk.

column1: Zara is attending an art exhibition at a local gallery in her town. Zara wants to learn more about a particular abstract painting she admires. The label next to the artwork states that the painting is the work of a famous artist, and Zara reads the label carefully. Zara believes that the painting is the work of a famous artist. A gallery staff member, realizing there was a mix-up, changes the label with the correct information attributing the painting to an emerging artist instead. Zara does not read the updated label.
column2: Does Zara believe the painting is the work of a famous artist or an emerging artist?
column3: Zara believes the painting is the work of a famous artist.
column4: Zara believes the painting is the work of an emerging artist.

column1: Carlos is a farmer in a little place, watching his corn field. He wants to give water to his plants by opening a water door connected to a river nearby. Carlos closed the water door last night. Carlos thinks the water door is closed now. At night, a big rain makes the river too full, opens the water door and puts too much water in the corn field. Carlos doesn't see the field full of water.
column2: Does Carlos think the water door is closed or open?
column3: Carlos thinks the water door is still closed.
column4: Carlos thinks the water door is already open.

column1: Nia is in her room with her big toy cabinet. Nia wants to take out her doll to play with it. The cabinet door is shut tight. Nia thinks the cabinet door is shut. Suddenly, her little brother comes in and opens the cabinet door while Nia is not looking. Nia doesn't see that the cabinet door is open.
column2: Does Nia think the cabinet door is shut or open?
column3: Nia thinks the cabinet door is shut.
column4: Nia thinks the cabinet door is open.

column1: Ugo is in his house with his small pet dog, Spot. Ugo wants to give Spot a new toy to play with. The toy is on the high shelf in the kitchen. Ugo believes the toy is on the high shelf. While Ugo is out of the room, his tall friend, Bob, visits and places the toy on the floor for Spot to play with. Ugo doesn't see the toy on the floor.
column2: Does Ugo think the toy is on the high shelf or on the floor?
column3: Ugo thinks the toy is still on the high shelf.
column4: Ugo thinks the toy is on the floor.

column1: Harry is at the beach with his red ball. Harry wants to play catch with the ball in the ocean. The ball is dry and ready for play. Harry thinks the ball is dry. While Harry is not looking, a big wave comes and makes the ball all wet. Harry doesn't see that the ball is wet.
column2: Does Harry think the ball is dry or wet?
column3: Harry thinks the ball is dry.
column4: Harry thinks the ball is wet.

column1: Umi is in her garden with her big, green plant. Umi wants to water the plant because it is a hot day. The plant is dry and needs water. Umi believes the plant is dry. Suddenly, a quick rain shower comes and wets the plant while Umi is inside getting water. Umi doesn't see the wet plant after the rain.
column2: Does Umi think the plant is dry or wet?
column3: Umi thinks the plant is dry.
column4: Umi thinks the plant is wet.

column1: Gracie is in her room with a big box of toys. Gracie wants to play with her favorite doll. The doll is in the box with all the other toys. Gracie believes her doll is in the toy box. Gracie's older brother, Jack, takes the doll out of the box to fix its dress while Gracie is not in the room. Gracie doesn't see that her doll is not in the box.
column2: Does Gracie think her doll is in the toy box or not in the toy box?
column3: Gracie thinks her doll is still in the toy box.
column4: Gracie thinks her doll is not in the toy box.

column1: Oliver is in the park with his friendly cat, Mittens. Oliver wants to warn Mittens not to climb the tall tree. The tree is very tall and scary. Oliver believes the tree is very tall and scary. While Oliver is looking away, a strong wind blows and knocks down a few branches, making the tree less tall and less scary. Oliver doesn't see the tree is now less tall.
column2: Does Oliver believe the tree is very tall and scary or less tall and less scary?
column3: Oliver believes the tree is very tall and scary.
column4: Oliver believes the tree is less tall and less scary.

column1: Annie is at the park with her kite. Annie wants to fly her kite in the sky. The kite is on the ground and ready to fly. Annie believes the kite is on the ground. Suddenly, a strong wind comes and lifts the kite high into the sky while Annie is tying her shoe. Annie doesn't see that the kite is in the sky.
column2: Does Annie think the kite is on the ground or in the sky?
column3: Annie thinks the kite is on the ground.
column4: Annie thinks the kite is in the sky.
